item.title: Apple to sell PowerSchool to Pearson
item.description: Exclusive Apple will sell PowerSchool, its division that develops student information systems for K-12 school districts, to Pearson Assessments, sources have confirmed to Think Secret. Terms of the sale are not known; Apple purchased the company in 2001 for $62 million.

item.title: Apple 10-Q: two new lawsuits, one settled
item.description: Apple's recent 10-Q filing reveals the company saw relatively little action on the legal front during its second fiscal quarter of 2006. Apple was on the receiving end of two new lawsuits during the quarter, while the company settled matters with one other.

item.title: Briefly: Apple seeds Mac OS X 10.4.7
item.description: Earlier this week, Apple provided developers with the first seed of the next update to Mac OS X, Version 10.4.7. The Intel build of the new update is marked build 8J2111, and includes about 60 documented improvements -- and a few known issues, as well.

item.title: Fifth Avenue store to boast retail innovations
item.description: Apple's upcoming midtown Manhattan retail store on Fifth Avenue, set to open Friday night, will be a testing ground for a number of new innovations in Apple retail. And the store will hit the ground running with a full-size staff, Think Secret has learned.

item.title: Photo Gallery: MacBook
item.description: Think Secret is offering a small gallery of photos of Apple's new MacBook, which the company announced just this morning. The 13.3-inch MacBook, which features the Intel Core Duo processor, is pictured in its new black enclosure.

item.title: Apple announces MacBook
item.description: Apple announced the long-awaited MacBook today, featuring the Intel Core Duo processor. As expected, the new laptop features a 13.3-inch widescreen display and is available in black and white. The company's plans to announce today were reported last week.

item.title: Briefly: Quicken 2007 enters beta testing
item.description: Intuit has started beta testing Quicken 2007, code-named MindTheGap, but like previous upgrades to the financial management software the new version will deliver more marginal improvements than its version number might imply.

item.title: Apple retail wrap-up: Quarterly performance drops, new locations eyed
item.description: With Apple's retail team putting the finishing touches on plans to open the last round of stores in fiscal year 2006, a clearer picture is emerging of the stores' performance and future direction. Also, an updated list of future stores.

item.title: MacBook's release sees one week postponement
item.description: Apple pulled its MacBook announcement, expected today, at the last minute due to supply issues related to the new laptop. The MacBook is now slated to arrive next week.

item.title: Apple bests Beatles in trademark suit [Updated]
item.description: Apple Computer has successfully defended itself against a trademark infringement suit the Beatles' record label brought against the company in 2003. Apple Corps said it plans to appeal the ruling. [First on TS: Complete judgment now available for download.]
